oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from William Dickson Shute to wife Lavinia
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter written from William Dickson Shute to his wife Lavinia Lafayette Hilliard, sent from Gayoso House in Memphis. He writes of leaving Jo Horton in Huntsville, coming home and being homesick, and taking care of property.

Lavinia Lafayette Hilliard (1837-1872) married William Dickson Shute (1834-1916) in 1856. William's father, Lee Shute, sold the Grassmere property to his son for $5 in 1859 on occasion of his marriage to Lavinia. The Shutes would have nine children together, but only four of them survived to adulthood: Margaret Shute, Leila Shute Tigert, Kate Shute Croft, and Lavinia Shute Hotchkiss.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Correspondence; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Personal narratives;
